page.title: 01Review and Gazetteer
page.content: {Review and Gazetteer This area is predominantly rural with agriculture and associated activities the main charcteristics. The two main settlements in the area, the villages of{Cliffe}and {Hemingbrough,}have expanded considerably in the last five years. In part this is due to their position on the edge of the multi-million pound development of the{Selby Coalfield. Other factors relating to their growth are the proximity of the villages to the M62 motorway which provides easy access for commuters to Hull and to Leeds, West Yorkshire and Lancashire, and the relative low cost of housing in attracive villages. Despite their growth the communities still retain their village identities. In the pages ahead we describe life as it appears to us in 1985.
